keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the beating death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was attacked three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility.

Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder and manslaughter charges despite being charged with involvement in the violent incident captured on body-camera footage.
The body-camera footage, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, with no apparent concern, which became central to the prosecution's case.

Prosecutor William Fitzpatrick, appointed as a special prosecutor due to Attorney General Letitia James’s recusal, led the investigation into Brooks’ death and is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025 beating of Messiah Nantwi.
The case revealed a pattern of systemic abuse and gang-like behavior among correctional officers, with the prosecution arguing that all guards acted together in a coordinated, violent manner.

Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault, was transferred from a nearby prison and attacked shortly after arrival, suffering severe internal injuries including liver and spleen damage.
Six of the 10 guards indicted in February were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and one pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at trial.
Kieffer was charged with second-degree gang assault and filing a false instrument, but acquitted on both counts; Galliher was charged with gang assault but acquitted.

The verdict underscores the broader issue of accountability and misconduct within correctional systems, particularly regarding the use of body-camera footage to expose abuse and hold officials responsible.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks, who was attacked multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The body-camera footage, which shows guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck with no apparent concern, became pivotal in the prosecution’s case. Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted despite being charged with murder and related offenses. The case revealed a coordinated, gang-like pattern of violence among officers, with prosecutors arguing that all guards acted with a depraved indifference to life. A separate investigation into the March 1, 2025, beating of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility is ongoing, with ten guards indicted, including two charged with murder. The case underscores systemic failures in prison oversight and accountability, especially in the face of widespread abuse captured on video.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
